change.item:
$Log: ml.xml,v $ Revision 1.4 2004/12/14 19:42:20 packel added entry/sense ids; fixed bad empty tags
Revision 1.3 2004/12/03 20:11:37 packel corrected some duplicate keys caused by fixing the compound verbs
Revision 1.2 2004/12/02 23:29:11 packel added key attributes to compound verb entries
Revision 1.1 2004/11/22 17:07:40 packel converted to P4/XML
Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys
Revision 1.18 2004/10/05 21:34:13 packel Aligned dictionary entries with the LSJ.
Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen
Revision 1.13 2001/12/05 15:15:58 gcrane shifted the lemma for "pa/nth" to be "pa/nth|"
Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.
Revision 1.11 2001/04/05 18:26:02 lcerrato added trans tags to noeo^ entry where missing
Revision 1.10 2000/10/06 23:20:04 dasmith Tagged inflectional info as Greek.
Revision 1.9 2000/10/06 21:44:13 dasmith Added author and ISBN to head. Use new DTD subset. Explicitly tag lemmata and cross references as Greek.
Revision 1.8 2000/03/04 20:25:11 dasmith Standardized language IDs. Added key attribute to entry.
Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.
Revision 1.6 1998/08/20 17:12:45 jrydberg Included greek words within trans tags where appropriate
Revision 1.5 1998/08/19 20:50:08 jrydberg Replaced all "(trans) or (/trans)" with " or "
Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.
Revision 1.3 1998/08/17 20:24:43 jrydberg *** empty log message ***
Revision 1.2 1998/08/17 19:38:25 jrydberg Updated entry for *)agamemno/neos
Revision 1.1 1998/08/14 15:38:33 textgod Added to repository.

div1.head: ξαίνω
div1.sense: to comb or card wool, so as to make it fit for spinning, Od., etc.
of cloth, to full or dress it, Ar.
metaph. to dress, thrash, beat, ῥάβδοις ἔξαινον τὰ σώματα Plut.:—Pass., ξανθέν mangled, Anth.;—c. acc. cogn., ξαίνειν κατὰ τοῦ νώτου πολλὰς (sc. πληγάς) Dem.

div1.head: ξανθίζω
div1.sense: to make yellow or brown, by roasting or frying, Ar.

div1.head: Ξανθίας
div1.sense: Xanthias, name of a slave in Comedy, Ar.;—no doubt he had yellow hair; cf. πυρρίας.

div1.head: ξανθόθριξ
div1.sense: yellow-haired, Solon., Theocr.

div1.head: ξανθοκάρηνος
div1.sense: with yellow head, Anth.

div1.head: ξανθός
div1.sense: yellow, of various shades; of golden hair, Hom.; so, ξανθαὶ ἵπποι bay or chestnut mares, Il.
Ξάνθος paroxyt., as prop. n.
a stream of the Troad, so called by gods, by men Scamander, Il.
a horse of Achilles, bayard, the other being Βαλίος, dapple, Il.

div1.head: ξανθότης
div1.sense: yellowness, esp. of hair, Strab.

div1.head: ξανθοτριχέω
div1.sense: to have yellow hair, Strab.

div1.head: ξανθοφυής
div1.sense: yellow by nature, ἕλικες Anth.

div1.head: ξανθοχίτων
div1.sense: with yellow coat, Anth.

div1.head: ξανθόχροος
div1.sense: with yellow skin, Mosch.

div1.head: ξεινήϊον
div1.etym: Ionic for ξενεῖον which is not used
div1.sense: a hostʼs gift, given to a departing guest, Hom.; δῶρα ξεινήια Od.

div1.head: ξεναγέτης
div1.sense: one who takes charge of guests, Pind.

div1.head: ξεναγέω
div1.sense: to be a ξεναγός, Xen., Dem.
to guide strangers, shew them the sights, Luc.: Pass., impers., ἄριστά σοι ξενάγηται your work as a guide has been done excellently, Plat.

div1.head: ξεναγός
div1.sense: a commander of auxiliary or mercenary troops (ξένοι) , Thuc., Xen., etc. (The form is Doric; but like many military terms, it was adopted in Attic)
a strangerʼs guide, Plut.

div1.head: ξεναπάτης
div1.sense: one who cheats strangers, or who cheats his host, Eur.

div1.head: ξεναρκής
div1.sense: aiding strangers, Pind.

div1.head: ξενηλασία
div1.sense: at Sparta, expulsion of foreigners, an alien act, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ξενηλατέω
div1.sense: to banish foreigners, Ar.

div1.head: ξένη
div1.sense: a female guest: a foreign woman, Aesch., etc.
(sub. γῆ) , a foreign country, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ξενία
div1.sense: the rights of a guest, hospitality, friendly entertainment or reception, Lat. hospitium, Od., Hdt., etc.

a friendly relation between two foreigners, or between an individual and a foreign state (cf. πρόξενος) , ξεινίην τινὶ συντίθεσθαι , Lat. hospitium facere cum aliquo, Hdt.; κατὰ τὴν ξ. because of their friendly relations, Thuc.; πρὸς ξενίας τᾶς σᾶς by thy friendship with us, Soph.
the state or disabilities of an alien, ξενίας φεύγειν (sc. γραφήν) to be indicted as an alien, Ar.

div1.head: ξενίζω
div1.sense: to receive or entertain strangers, to receive as a guest, Lat. hospitio excipere, Hom., Hdt., etc.; ξ. τινὰ πολλοῖς ἀγαθοῖς to present with hospitable gifts, Xen.:—metaph., ὃν Ἄρης οὐκ ἐξένισεν, i. e. who fell not in battle, Soph.:—Pass. to be entertained as a guest, Hdt., Attic
to astonish by some strange sight, Polyb.:—Pass. to be astonished, Polyb.
intr. to be a stranger, speak with a foreign accent, Luc.: to be strange or unusual, Luc.

div1.head: ξενικός
div1.sense: of or for a stranger, of foreign kind, opp. to ἀστικός, Eur.; ξενικά the taxes paid by aliens at Athens, Dem.;— τὸ ξ. the class of aliens, Arist.; τὸ ξ. (sc. δικαστήριον) the court in which aliens sued or were sued, Arist.
of soldiers, hired for service, mercenary, Hdt., Xen. τὸ ξενικόν οἱ ξένοι, a body of mercenaries, Ar., Thuc., etc.
= ξένιος, hospitable, friendly, Aeschin.:— ἡ ξενική friendly relation, as between host and guest, Arist.
foreign, alien, Hdt.; ξ. ὀνόματα foreign names, Plat.; of style, foreign, I. e. abounding in unusual words, Arist.

div1.head: ξένιος
div1.sense: belonging to a friend and guest, hospitable, Ζεὺς ξένιος as protector of the rights of hospitality, Il., Aesch.:— τράπεζα ξ. the guestsʼ table, Od.; ξένιός τινι bound to him by ties of hospitality, Hdt.

ξείνια, Attic ξένια, ων, τά, friendly gifts, meat and drink, given to the guest by his host, Hom.; ξένια παρέσχε δαῖτα as a friendly gift, Aesch.; βοῦν ξένια ἔπεμψεν Xen.; ἐπὶ ξένια καλεῖν to invite any one to eat with you, Hdt., etc.; metaph., θάνατος ξένιά σοι γενήσεται Eur.
foreign, Pind., Attic

div1.head: ξένισις
div1.sense: the entertainment of guests, Thuc.

div1.head: ξενιτεία
div1.sense: a living abroad, Luc.

div1.head: ξενιτεύω
div1.sense: to live abroad, Luc.
Dep. ξενιτεύομαι, to be in foreign service, Isocr.

div1.head: ξενοδαίκτης
div1.sense: one who murders guests, Eur.

div1.head: ξενοδαίτης
div1.sense: one that devours guests or strangers, of the Cyclops, Eur.

div1.head: ξενοδοκέω
div1.sense: Ionic ξεινο-, to entertain guests or strangers, Hdt., Eur., etc.:—in late Gr. ξενοδοχέω, NTest.

div1.head: ξενοδόκος
div1.sense: one who receives strangers, a host, Od.

div1.head: ξενοδοχία
div1.sense: entertainment of a stranger, Xen.

div1.head: ξενοδώτης
div1.sense: a host, epith. of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ξενόεις
div1.sense: full of strangers, Eur.

div1.head: ξενοθυτέω
div1.sense: to sacrifice strangers, Strab.

div1.head: ξενοκτονέω
div1.sense: to slay guests or strangers, Hdt., Eur.
to slay oneʼs host, Eur.

div1.head: ξενοκτόνος
div1.sense: slaying guests or strangers, Eur., Aeschin.

div1.head: ξενολογέω
div1.sense: to enlist strangers, levy mercenaries, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ξενολόγος
div1.sense: levying mercenaries, Polyb.

div1.head: ξενοπαθέω
div1.sense: to have a strange feeling, feel strange or shy, Plut.

div1.head: ξένος
div1.sense: a guest-friend, I. e. any citizen of a foreign state, with whom one has a treaty of hospitality for self and heirs, confirmed by mutual presents (ξένια) and an appeal to Ζεὺς ξένιος, Hom.
of one of the parties bound by ties of hospitality, i. e. either the guest, or = ξεινοδόκος, the host, Hom., Hdt., etc.
any one entitled to hospitality, a stranger, refugee, Od.
any stranger or foreigner, Hes., Attic:—the term was politely used of any one whose name was unknown, and the address ὦ ξένε came to mean little more than friend, Soph.
a foreign soldier, hireling, mercenary, Thuc., Xen.
div1.head: ξένος
div1.sense: foreign, Soph., Eur., etc.
c. gen. rei, strange to a thing, ignorant of it, Soph.:—adv., ξένως ἔχω τῆς λέξεως I am a stranger to the language, Plat.
alien, strange, unusual, Aesch.

div1.head: ξενόστασις
div1.sense: a lodging for guests or strangers, Soph.

div1.head: ξενοσύνη
div1.sense: hospitality, Od.

div1.head: ξενότιμος
div1.sense: honouring strangers, Aesch.

div1.head: ξενοτροφέω
div1.sense: to entertain strangers, to maintain mercenary troops, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ξενοφονέω
div1.sense: to murder strangers, Eur.

div1.head: ξενοφόνος
div1.sense: murdering strangers, Eur.

div1.head: ξενόω
div1.sense: to make oneʼs friend and guest, Aesch.
mostly in Pass., with fut. mid. ξενώσομαι: perf. ἐξένωμαι: aor1 ἐξενώθην:
to enter into a treaty of hospitality with one, Lat. hospitio jungi, c. dat., Hdt., Xen.; absol., Xen.
to take up his abode with one as a guest, to be entertained, Trag.
to be in foreign parts, to be abroad, Soph., Eur.: to go into banishment, Eur.

div1.head: ξενών
div1.sense: a guest-chamber, Eur.

div1.head: ξένωσις
div1.sense: a being abroad, Eur.

div1.head: ξερόν
div1.sense: dry land, ποτὶ ξερόν to the dry land, Od., Anth.

div1.head: ξέστης
div1.sense: = Lat. sextarius, nearly a pint, NTest.

div1.head: ξεστός
div1.sense: smoothed, polished, wrought, Hom., Hdt., Attic; ξ. αἴθουσαι halls of polished stone, Il.

div1.head: ξέω
div1.sense: to smooth or polish by scraping, planing, filing, of a carpenter, Od., etc.

div1.head: ξηραίνω
div1.sense: to parch up, dry up, Eur., Xen.:—Pass. to become or be dry, parched, Il., etc.
to lay dry, Lat. siccare, Thuc.

div1.head: ξηραλοιφέω
div1.sense: properly to rub dry with oil, without the use of the bath, Lex ap. Plut., Aeschin.

div1.head: ξηραμπέλινος
div1.sense: of the colour of withered vine-leaves, bright red, Juven.

div1.head: ξηρά
div1.sense: ( sc. γῆ) dry land, v. ξηρός III.

div1.head: ξηρός
div1.sense: dry, Lat. siccus, opp. to ὑγρός, Hdt., Ar.; ξηροῖς ὄμμασι, Hor.ʼs siccis oculis, Aesch.
of bodily condition, withered, lean, haggard, δέμας Eur., Theocr.
like Lat. siccus, fasting, austere, harsh, Eur., Ar.; ἐν ξηροῖσιν ἐκτρέφειν Eur.
as Subst., ἡ ξηρά (sc. γῆ) , dry land, Xen.; so, τὸ ξηρόν Hdt.; ναῦς ἐπὶ τοῦ ξηροῦ ποιεῖν to leave the ships aground, Thuc.

div1.head: ξηρότης
div1.sense: dryness, Plat., Xen.: ἡ ξ. τῶν νεῶν the dryness, i. e. soundness, of their timbers, Thuc.

div1.head: ξηροφαγέω
div1.sense: to eat dry food, Anth., etc.

div1.head: ξῖ
div1.sense: Ξ, ξ, ξῖ, τό, indecl., fourteenth letter of the Gk. alphabet: as numeral ξ 60, but ξ 60, 000: introduced in the archonship of Euclides, 403 B. C.—It is a double consonant, compounded of γς, κς, or χς. Changes

ξ in Aeolic and Attic appears as an aspirated form of κ, cf. ξυνός with κοινός, ξύν with cum;— or of ς, cf. ξύν with σύν, ξέστης with Lat. sextarius; and so in Doric fut. of Verbs in -ζω, κομίξω κλᾳξῶ παιξῶ for κομίσω κλῄσω παίσω.
interchanged with σς, Ionic διξός, τριξός for δισσός, τρισσός.

div1.head: ξιφήρης
div1.sense: sword in hand, Eur.

div1.head: ξιφηφόρος
div1.sense: sword in hand, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ξιφίδιον
div1.sense: a dagger, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ξιφιστήρ
div1.sense: a sword-belt, Plut.

div1.head: ξιφοδήλητος
div1.sense: slain by the sword, ξ. θάνατος death by the sword, Aesch.

div1.head: ξιφοκτόνος
div1.sense: slaying with the sword, Soph.

div1.head: ξίφος
div1.sense: a sword, Hom.; distinguished from μάχαιρα, q. v.

div1.head: ξιφουλκία
div1.sense: the drawing of a sword, Plut.

div1.head: ξιφουλκός
div1.sense: drawing a sword, Aesch.

div1.head: ξιφουργός
div1.sense: a sword-cutler, Ar.

div1.head: ξόανον
div1.sense: an image carved of wood, Xen.: generally, an image, statue, Eur.

div1.head: ξοανουργία
div1.sense: a carving of images, Luc.

div1.head: ξοΐς
div1.sense: a sculptorʼs chisel, anth.

div1.head: ξουθόπτερος
div1.sense: with tawny wings, Eur.

div1.head: ξουθός
div1.sense: of a colour, between ξανθός and πυρρός, yellowish, brown-yellow, tawny, epith. of the bee, Eur.; of the nightingale, Aesch., Eur., etc.
later of sound, shrill, thrilling, Babr., Anth.

div1.head: ξυήλη
div1.sense: a tool for scraping wood, a plane or rasp, Xen.
a sickle-shaped dagger, Xen.

div1.head: ξυληγέω
div1.sense: to carry wood, Dem.

div1.head: ξυλήφιον
div1.sense: a piece of wood, a stick, Polyb.

div1.head: ξυλίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to gather wood, Xen.

div1.head: ξύλινος
div1.sense: of wood, wooden, Hdt., Attic
metaph. wooden, νοῦς Anth.

div1.head: ξυλοκοπέω
div1.sense: to beat with a stick, cudgel, Polyb.

div1.head: ξυλοκοπία
div1.sense: a cudgelling, Lat. fustuarium, Polyb.

div1.head: ξυλοκόπος
div1.sense: hewing or felling wood, Xen.

div1.head: ξύλον
div1.sense: wood cut and ready for use, firewood, timber, Hom.; ξύλα νήια ship- timber, Hes.; ξ. ναυπηγήσιμα Thuc.
in sg. a piece of wood, a post, Hom.: a perch, Ar.: a stick, cudgel, club, Hdt., Ar.
a collar of wood, put on the neck of the prisoner, Ar.:—also stocks, for the feet, Hdt., Ar.; cf. πεντεσύριγγος.
a plank or beam to which malefactors were bound, the Cross, NTest.
a money-changerʼs table, Dem.
πρῶτον ξύλον the front bench of the Athenian theatre, Ar.
of live wood, a tree, Xen.

div1.head: ξυλοπαγής
div1.sense: built of wood, Strab.

div1.head: ξυλουργέω
div1.sense: to work wood, Hdt.

div1.head: ξυλουργία
div1.sense: a working of wood, carpentry, Aesch.

div1.head: ξυλοφάγος
div1.sense: eating wood, Strab.

div1.head: ξυλοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry a stick, as the Cynics did, Luc.

div1.head: ξύλοχος
div1.sense: a thicket, copse, Il.

div1.head: ξύλωσις
div1.sense: the woodwork of a house, frame-work, Thuc.

div1.head: ξυνεείκοσι
div1.sense: Epic for συν-είκοσι, twenty together, Od.

div1.head: ξυνήϊος
div1.etym: Epic and Ionic for ξύνειος, which does not occur
div1.sense: ξυνήια common property, common stock, Il.

div1.head: ξυνήων
div1.sense: a joint-owner, partner in a thing, c. gen., Hes.; ξυνάονες ἑλκέων, I. e. afflicted by sores, Pind.:—absol., ξυνάν a friend, Pind.

div1.head: ξυνοδοτήρ
div1.sense: the free, bounteous giver, Anth.

div1.head: ξυνός
div1.sense: older form of κοινός, common, public, general, concerning or belonging to all in common, Il.; γαῖα ξυνὴ πάντων earth the common property of all, Il.; ξ. Ἐνυάλιος, i. e. war hath an even hand, is uncertain, Il.; ξ. πᾶσι ἀγαθόν Hdt.; ξυνὰ λέγειν to speak for the common good, Aesch.

div1.head: ξυνόφρων
div1.sense: friendly-minded, Anth.

div1.head: ξυνοχαρής
div1.sense: rejoicing in common, Anth.

div1.head: ξυρέω
div1.sense: to shave, Hdt.: proverb. of great danger or sharp pain, ξυρεῖ ἐν χρῶι it shaves close, touches the quick, Soph.:—Mid. and Pass. to shave oneself or have oneself shaved, Hdt.; ξυρεῦνται πᾶν τὸ σῶμα they have their whole body shaved, Hdt.

div1.head: ξυρήκης
div1.sense: keen as a rasor, Xen.
pass. close-shaven, Eur.; κουρᾷ ξυρήκει with close tonsure, Eur.

div1.head: ξυρόν
div1.sense: a rasor, Hom., etc.:—proverb, ἐπὶ ξυροῦ ἵσταται ἀκμῆς ὄλεθρος ἠὲ βιῶναι death or life is balanced on a rasorʼs edge, Il.; ἐπὶ ξυροῦ τῆς ἀκμῆς ἔχεται ἡμῖν τὰ πράγματα Hdt.; βεβὼς ἐπὶ ξυρῷ τύχης Soph.

div1.head: ξυσμή
div1.sense: in pl., scrapings, Anth.

div1.head: ξυστήρ
div1.sense: a graving tool, Lat. scalprum, Anth.

div1.head: ξυστίς
div1.sense: a xystis, a robe of fine material, a robe of state, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ξυστοβόλος
div1.sense: spear-darting, Anth.

div1.head: ξυστόν
div1.sense: the polished shaft of a spear, Il., Hdt.
generally, a spear, lance, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ξυστός
div1.sense: scraped, polished, Hdt.

div1.head: ξυστός2
div1.sense: a covered colonnade on the S. side of the gymnasium, where athletes exercised in winter, Xen., etc.: so called from its smooth and polished floor.

div1.head: ξυστοφόρος
div1.sense: carrying a spear, Xen.

div1.head: ξύω
div1.sense: to scrape, plane, smooth or polish, Od.: metaph., ξῦσαι ἀπὸ γῆρας to scrape off, get rid of old age, Hhymn.:— Mid., παλτὸν ξύσασθαι to shape oneself a javelin-shaft, Xen.
to make smooth, work delicately, Il.
